info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN NORTHUMBERLAND... MONTOUR...SOUTHEASTERN LYCOMING...COLUMBIA AND SOUTH CENTRAL SULLIVAN COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 336 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bloomsburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. Other strong storms were northwest of this storm. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Bloomsburg, Berwick, Danville, Watsontown, Elysburg, Riverside, Catawissa, Mifflinville, Lightstreet, Almedia, Fernville, Mechanicsville, Buckhorn, Numidia, Jerseytown, Rupert, Slabtown, Rohrsburg, Iola and Jamison City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania.
